page.title: 15Country Roads, Randalstown
page.content: In total there are twelve roads throughout the area. Four are'B'class roads: Portglenone, Ahoghill, Roguery and Whitesides Roads. To the east the Caddy road is class 'C', while the others are narrow minor roads. Numerous laneways lead off these to the farmhouses. The average width of the 'B' roads is 7 meters , while the smaller roads average only 3.5 meters. Maintenance of these is carried out by the Dept.of the Environment, and is paid for by the local district council. The smaller roads are geneally in poor condition ,with lots of potholes and areas where the tarmac has been broken up. However these roads are mainly only used by local people and farmers tending their land. In many places it is difficult for two vehicles to pass safely. Hedgerows also hinder vision.
